Love the atmosphere, roomy inside despite being a shotgun space. Kudos for the built in banquette and small, beautiful wood tables. Nice alternative to sitting at the bar. Couches and chairs fill the window up front.
It seemed the customers all purchased the homemade jerkey. I would prefer another snack option.
Parking is easy and free, do not leave anything visible or i guarantee you will be sorry. Or take the t line, just steps outside the front door.
Glad to see an upscale, less crowded alternative to the dog patch saloon.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Really delicious and well priced cocktails. Got the Mt. Tam and the American Gothic for ten bucks a pop. The beef jerky was also highly delicious - my fave was the coffee one. Will be back for happy hour. 

One downside: there isn't a ton to do in the area.
author: Ben G.

description: YES! YES! & YES! This has become my favorite bar in SF. Now that's a huge compliment since I've been bartending over a decade and know how to make a damn good drink. The decor is pleasant, lovely Danish chairs. The liquor selection is above par and the cocktail menu is superb. Like beef jerky? Third Rail makes their own, and yes, it's Deliscious (sorry vegans). If you are a fan of Trick Dog, Contogna, TheEuropean, or any other amazing cocktail-laborious-mixology bars, this is your place. Located in the Dogpatch, up and coming location, right off the muni station at Third street there is no need to drive but ample parking just in case.
author: TVAT T.

description:
I came here since 7x7 featured Third Rail's Mt. Tam. Personally, not for me though I enjoyed our little show from our Bartender. She slapped a bay leaf above the drink to bring out its juices or just for a cool effect and to wow us haha :).

What I did like were the Tally Ho's and the rhubarb drink (tasted like rhubarb pie). Drinks are good and strong and reasonably priced ($10). Would definitely go back!
author: Christina C.

description:
Put this place on your list. The atmosphere is old school San Francisco. It may be a bit hipster but the drinks are engaging and creative. 

The bartenders are great!
author: Chris W.

description:
Third Rail is one of the better cocktail bars in the Dogpatch, there are others like it, but this one is mine. If you're in the mood for some post-work Jerky, or after-work cocktails; hit up the Third Rail! Order off the menu, it's worth it if you know what you want.

It gets a little hot and crowded, but luckily, they open the windows if you ask.
author: Trace D.

description:
New favorite bar. As a beef jerky junkie, I'm sincerely upset I didn't come up with the idea for this place myself. 

All cocktails cost $10. For the amount of alcohol in each drink, they are a steal. Our favorites were the '12 Angry Men' and the 'Bone Machine' (both whiskey-driven). The bartenders were all very friendly and can make you something off the menu if you ask.

They have several varieties of jerky available and my friends and I tried all of them, apart from the "vegetable jerky" (which is an affront to jerky in my carnivorous lifestyle, but maybe that's your bag). The clear favorite in our group was the "spicy beef candy" which was sweet, spicy, sticky, and delicious. We also really enjoyed the "cowboy" and "red eye" as well as all three jerky sticks which have interesting and varying flavors and textures. Jerky is ~$2.50/oz and I'd get at least 2oz per person to start.

We never intended for our dinner to be in jerky and liquid form that night, but after three rounds that's exactly what happened. I'll definitely be back, especially if it's too late in the day to hit up The Ramp.
author: Thomas U.

description: Cozy spot to meet friends for a drink in the 3rd St/Dogpatch area. Their cocktails are well-prepared and the jerky is made in the owner's restaurant. Definitely worth a return visit!
author: Sandy G.

description:
Been here a couple times now. I believe all the cocktails on the menu are $10, and all the ones I've tried so far have not disappointed. I think my favorites are the Tally Ho and Envy.

Service is good, but mainly because I haven't gone here when it has been too crazy crowded, and we have always gotten seats for our group. I'm enjoying the casual vibe and tasty cocktails while this place is still a bit low-key.
author: Zell C.

description: Mind blown by the bartenders in this intimate paradise. By far the best Old Fashioned in San Francisco. It seems that the secret has gotten out but it doesn't take much to fill this place so I like to get there early. One block away from my office and I cannot make it there often enough.
author: Valerie B.

description:
Great addition to this neighborhood.  It is not a bar that you should travel across town for, but for its casual setting and above average cocktails.  This is the bar to be shall you find yourself in dog patch.  

Most cocktail are bourbon based. The Third Rail and Double Date are my favorite. 

As with all the new bars and restaurants in this town, the acoustic is terrible. If your group is larger than 3, prepare to lose your voice.

The beef jerky is a the only snack available and sold by the oz. Four kind made in house. Best one is Red Eye. Bought some to take home with me. A real treat.
author: Alice C.

description: These bartenders are snobby. First they went out of their way to correct my friend when she said "Jame-o," stating, "that's so collegy," then they spilled drinks all over my friends and I, given it's an accident and they knocked our bill down to $11, they definitely gave us attitude when they rang us up. Rude and unprofessional.
author: Tina T.

description:
Arrived a little after 5 on a Friday and the place was busy but not crazy. Bartenders were friendly, attentive, and mosti importantly skilled. 

Cocktail menu is awesome because it's organized by type of drink you'd be in the mood for. Among the group, we had 6 different drinks and they were all fantastic - some dangerously so, others potently so. 

Great use of fresh ingredients, good vibe (not douche-y). Would buy again.
author: Jen C.

description: Great whiskey cocktails. The Third Rail cocktail was delicious. Clean and classy neighborhood bar! Jeff was so much fun!
author: Lily Y.

description:
Uhmmmmm Errrrrrr well Ok... 
I live a mere two blocks away....so Ive been waiting for evah to see how me old fave Retox has been upgraded to chic to meet our ever growing & demanding & desired & deserving Dogpatch destinations for a libation and hangout...

The unique fancy bourgeois Third Rail is an "okay" for now...

If you read my reviews you will see Im easy.....Im real easy after a libation if you really want to know... So they have some good cocktails...cool menu... Of course I dont know how much anything costs yet... And I did order a drink that requires Ginger Ale.... Ooooops. Go figure. They dont have it...oh and OH No.

You tell me...I do live steps away & perhaps being a local... Im happy to say there are other choices nearby...

Choices where the Staff and Service and extraordinary... Now Im not knocking service here just yet.... But first thought and experience is I really should.  (Sigh) there is about 1 bartender for 3 customers... Maybe great attentive friendly Service is something you would automatically expect.... I will cross my fingers - perhaps next time... ( read between the lines ) this time Service was a disappointment. 

Interiors - Awesome
Music - Awesome
Jerky - Awesome
Ambiance - Awesome
Cleanliness - Awesome

Service - Heavy Sigh 

Prices - Fair

Maybe next time....we have some great places a couple blocks away - in one direction you get views of the city... in the other direction you can sit next to the water...
author: Bryan G. W.

description: Always a great drink and service, with a great atmosphere.  Try a rail shot, it's a beer, shot, and jerkey for only $10.
author: Jason G.

description:
Must return again for the following:

Mt. Tam
Tally-Ho 
Double Date
Envy 

(Not necessarily in that order--and not all in one visit)
author: R H.

description: Amazing cocktails, yummy jerky snacks, good background music. The cocktails take a while to be made - inherent in the recipes - which can be a bit of a drag.
author: Antonia T.

description: Great "hole in the wall" bar in Dogpatch...a definite up and coming area for good food and libations.  Unlike the Mission, you can even find parking nearby.  Quiet (depending on crowd!) and divey kind of place that serves great artisan drinks, a plethora of whiskies and a fine selection of beers.  Appears they have an interesting selection of jerkins as well, but I didn't try them.  Perfect spot for a late afternoon quiet business discussion.  I can see it might be overwhelming if there is a large crowd.
author: Howard B.

description: Attentive bartender. Good mix of drinks. Reasonably priced.  Cool concept with large square ice cubes.  Relaxed quiet lounge-y atmosphere - not a hopping loud trendy spot but not a dive bar.  Thumbs up :)
author: Jenny K.

description: Love this spot. Jeff is a great bartender and makes an awesome old fashioned. Friendly people and not crowded.
author: Jeff H.

description: This is what a bar is supposed to be. Well poured, exceptional mixed drinks and who the hell ever knew beef / pork jerky could be this good? Not Me.
author: Ian M.

description:
Excellent bar! I've always had fantastic drinks and friendly service here. They really care about quality and having happy customers. Good, varied menu, and they're adept at creating anything else that your whimsical self may be in the mood for. Plus, I don't like my drinks with ice (it just gets in the way of the booze!), and they've always been gracious about adapting their drinks to suit my "up" requests.

Plus, gotta love the jerky. But... consider whether you're with someone who you're happy gnawing along with. First date gnawfest? Your call.

Also, love the space -- very clean and comfortable with various seating options.
author: Nina W.

description: Visited Dog Patch for the first time for a birthday at Third Rail.  Drinks were great for only $10 a pop!!  PLUS you can pair with delicious in homemade beef jerky?  I must say, the Dog Patch area was sort of a wasteland of cold empty upscale condo's with not much else to offer in sight.  But I'm glad there are a few places like the Third Rail, that made my awkward walk all the way from the Embacadero worth it.
author: Devin D.

description: Drinks were expensive....but, like anything handcrafted and made with love, it was worth it.  There are numerous drink choices to be crafted before you, but I went with whiskey-based drinks.  I don't remember the names of the beverages I ordered, but they were deliciously intoxicating.  I'd recommend this place to anyone that has an affinity for handcrafted cocktails.
author: Michael G.

description: Phil and Justin made sure that my girlfriend's birthday went off without a hitch. The reservation process was simple, although I made it probably more complicated by asking a lot of questions (all of this was handled via e-mail and one call)...but simply put, all you have to do is drop a credit card to hold your place, give them a general head count a few days out, and they'll have some tables set up for you. The card isn't charged; you just have to give 48 hours advance notice if you cancel or you get some type of drink credit if you don't show up and/or less than 48 hours notice. But as long as you show up on your scheduled day/time...you're money. We had the tables near the back, so we had easy access to the bartenders the entire night. The place got pretty packed throughout the evening, so I was glad we set up some tables. Justin introduced himself to me when I arrived just to give me the general lay of the land and let me know how everything would work. The drinks were flowing (Third Rail was my favorite), the jerky was eaten, and all seemed to be happy. It gets kind of hot in here if there's a lot of people, since the only real ventilation is the front door, so make sure to keep yourself cool. Sweet cocktail place in the vast terrain known as the Dogpatch.
author: Dan M.

description:
This is my favorite cocktail bar in the city.  I've spent many, many hours at home trying to reverse-engineer their drinks (with some luck, actually!) and you have to appreciate the inventiveness and quality of all their combinations.  

The Third Rail (bourbon, honey, lillet blanc, and lemon) is practically universally popular, even for those who typically are scared off by whiskey; sightly more aggressive is the evil twin, with mezal, grapefruit, and chile bitters (smoky and spicy!); and on the complex and spirit-forward end of the spectrum, the 12 Angry Men has rye, charteuse and gran classico for a slightly bitter and full-bodied experience.

It's all of the nuance and deliciousness of a top-quality cocktail bar, but with hardly any of the pretension.  If I weren't such a fan, I wouldn't rate, if only to keep it a local secret.
author: Jesse O.

description: Great cocktail menu.  Lots of people on a Friday night, but what isn't busy in San Francisco?  I had a drinked called the Bone Machine.  Really good.
author: Laura B.

description: Fantastic fresh food from the garden, great wine and great service. Definitely coming back!
author: Aditya B.

description: Swanky in the right way.  Outstanding cocktails.  They really did a make-over of this place if you remember what it used to look like as Retox.  I'm hoping they figure out someway to get the basement area going again.  I had lots of fun times down there.
author: Jan S.

description: Excellent hipster cocktail bar. Best aviation I have ever had.
author: Ben G.

description: New hot spot in Dogpatch!  They have an extensive list of specialty cocktails (15 if memory serves me correctly) and they serve an assortment of beef jerky (yes, beef jerky).  It's a compact spot with a modernist flare.  Love the signage -- quite beautiful and makes me wish more shops took signage seriously.  Service is friendly but you have to work your way up to the bar.
author: Kevin M.

description: Very cool bar - nice layout, great drinks, friendly service and sweet location. The drinks were well crafted, strong and tasted fresh. They have lots of jerky that was popular but I didn't try it. Really great spot!
author: Julia W.

description: Best bar in SF I'm super picky and am never satisfied or happy with my drinks... I loved everything they served me. I will be back.
author: Melinda I.

description: Super cute, low-key bar in Dogpatch. Nice place away from the bustle of SOMA. All the cocktails we had were delish, esp the Third Rail.
author: Laurie M.

description: This place is smaller than most bars but so much better. Great seating and interesting drinks. Always go for their rail shot combo (beer, shot, and beef jerkey) for $10. Can't go wrong. It does get packed at night though so I'd get here earlier than the regular crowd.
author: Ana J.

description: Sad my time there was short, but I thoroughly enjoyed my rail shot (beer, whiskey shot and jerky combo). Friendly bartenders and patrons. Good times. I'll be back.
author: Eli J.

description: Best margarita I ever had at a bar. The bartenders are nice and actually talk to the customers. Great friendly place will definitely come here again.
author: mary d.

description: Strong drinks, good music, not pretentious, good jerky, not bro-tastic, not douchey = AWESOME. Stop in & give them some traffic. Bartenders & owners are knowledgeable & fun to chat with.
author: Anne W.

description: My partner and I went here because we wanted to try the jerky. Trust we were not disappointed! The jerky was great and the mixed drinks were nice and strong! The atmosphere has a great vibe and the bartender is really cool. I would recommend it if you wanted to come and have chill place to try some jerky and sip on your cocktail. We will be coming back and bringing our friends!
author: Scott T.

description: Great place to get jerky at night. That's right. Jerky. Try the candy jerky.
author: Inigo M.

description: L-E-G-I-T. This place is superstar concept amd awesome service woth higly skilled mixologists.
author: Brian S.

description: Happy hour until 6.  The jerkey is out of control good.  We didn't have any cocktails to can't rate them, but ambiance is nice (limited seating) and the staff is very friendly.
author: Matt W.

description: Beef Jerky and Whisky pairings? I've never heard of a better idea! This place is amazing. Absolutely worth it.
author: Austin S.

description: BEST new bar in the area and maybe the city!!!!  The craft cocktails are absolutely amazing and the bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly.  The atmosphere is modern/rustic and is a perfect spot to grab a drink with a friend or go on a date :)  They also have a "jerky menu" featuring all kinds of beef, pork, and veggie jerky to accompany your cocktail.  The veggie jerky they featured recently was mushroom and I could not get enough -- SO SO good!!!  Hidden gem but I'm certain that it won't be for long!
author: Nicole M.

description: nice place, I know it from my friend, good service , nice food, will introduce it to my friend and come here again. Hope you can come here too.
author: Rocky J.

description: I almost hesitate to write a review as I fear it will become too popular/too crowded to get in. The atmosphere is great, relaxed and really comfortable. The bartenders make killer drinks and their bourbon menu is pretty extensive. Bourbon paired with their jerky tastings...I HIGHLY recommend.
author: Rob F.

description: Welcome to Dogpatch! Thank you for offering great cocktails in a fun vibe with friendly service.
author: Vicki L.

description: Great classic drinks! Huge liquor selection! Great Vibe! Try the Harvest Moon and any of Beef Jerkies! Will come back for sure.
author: BobDigi K.

description: Was so excited to come here bc of all the good reviews. Well, don't believe them. The bartender is a total dick, so rude. With service like that, they should be put out of business so a place with nicer people can be there
author: Angela Z.
